fdd:FDD.titleName: Matroska File Format with FFV1 video encoding

fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:fullName: Matroska File Format with FFV1 video encoding
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:description:
Matroska file containing video essence encoded as FFV1.
Supported encodings are declared via the unique Codec ID in the Matroska Codec Mappings. For FFV1 files, the information is the following:
Codec ID: V_FFV1
Codec Name: FF Video Codec 1 (note that versions are not declared in the title)
Initialization: For FFV1 versions 0 or 1, Private Data SHOULD NOT be written. For FFV1 version 3 or greater, the Private Data MUST contain the FFV1 Configuration Record structure, as defined in RFC 9043 section 4.3, and no other data.
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:shortDescription: Matroska file containing video essence encoded as FFV1.
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:productionPhase: Middle state, used for storage or archiving

fdd:relationship.fdd:comment: Sound essences and other elements, not described at this time.

fdd:localUse.fdd:experience: As of November 2021, the National Audio-Visual Conservation Center (NAVCC) has ingested several hundred ffv1/mkv files. These files were received from CUNY-TV through the American Archive of Public Broadcasting and the Library will receive many more of these files through the AAPB in the future.
fdd:localUse.fdd:preference: FFV1 codec in the Matroska container is a 'preferred' format in the Recommended Formats Statement (RFS) for Video -- File-based Improved support for timecode, as opposed to timestamps, is still in development as is support for multi-planar and 3D videos.

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:adoption: Steadily increasing adoption of Matroska and FFV1_v0-1-3 in heritage repositories, including the Library of Congress in 2023.
